data: Jack Bass Jack Bass Emeritus Faculty Professor Emeritus 567 Wilson Rd., Room 4220 (517) 884-5651 bassj@msu.edu http://www.pa.msu.edu/people/bass/  1964: Ph.D., University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign 1961: M.S., University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign 1959: B.S., California Institute of Technology Spin-Flipping at sputtered Co 90 Fe 10 /Cu Interfaces, (H.Y.T.Nguyen, R. Acharyya, W.P. Pratt Jr., and J. Bass) J. Appl. Phys. 109, 07C903 (2011). Spin-Diffusion Lengths in Metals and Alloys, and Spin-Flipping at Metal/Metal Interfaces: an Experimentalistâ€™s Critical Review, (J. Bass and W.P. Pratt Jr.) J. Phys. Cond. Matt. 19, 183201 (2007). Generation and Detection of Phase Coherent Current-Driven Magnons in Magnetic Multilayers, (M. Tsoi, A.G.M. Jansen, J. Bass, W.-C. Chiang, V. Tsoi, and P. M. Wyder), Nature 406, 46 (2000). Current Perpendicular (CPP) Magnetoresistance in Magnetic Metallic Multilayers (J. Bass and W.P. Pratt Jr.), J. Magn. Magn. Mat. 200, 274 (1999). Excitation of a Magnetic Multilayer by Electric Current. (M.Tsoi, A.G.M. Jansen, J. Bass, W.-C. Chiang, M. Seck, V. Tsoi, and P. Wyder). Phys. Rev. Lett. 80, 4281 (1998). Perpendicular Giant Magnetoresistances of Ag/Co Multilayers (W.P. Pratt Jr., S.-F. Lee, J. M. Slaughter, R. Loloee, P.A. Schroeder, and J. Bass), Phys. Rev. Lett. 66, 3060 (1991). Electron-Phonon Mass Enhancement in Thermoelectricity, (J.L. Opsal, B.J. Thaler, and J. Bass), Phys. Rev. Lett. 36, 1211 (1976). Deviations from Matthiessen's Rule, (J. Bass), Adv. in Phys., 21, 431 (1972). Full Publications List Research Interests Experimental Condensed Matter Physics: Electronic Transport in Metals; Point Defects in Metals; Ultra-low Temperature Transport; Spin-Glasses; Magnetic Metallic Nanostructures; Giant Magnetoresistance in Metallic Multilayers with Current-flow Perpendicular-to-the layer Planes (CPP-MR); Spin-torque; Spintronics in Metals. Biographical Information Total publications and in press (as of 2013): 209. Joined MSU Physics faculty in 1964. Completed Ph.D. degrees supervised: 21. Chair, MSU Physics-Astronomy Dept., 1983-1988.
